uk.co.dancowan.robots.ui.views.connection
Class ConnectionView

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.core.commands.common.EventManager
      org.eclipse.ui.part.WorkbenchPart
          org.eclipse.ui.part.ViewPart
              uk.co.dancowan.robots.ui.views.ScrolledView
                  uk.co.dancowan.robots.ui.views.connection.ConnectionView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IAdaptable, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension, org.eclipse.jface.util.IPropertyChangeListener, org.eclipse.ui.IPersistable, org.eclipse.ui.IViewPart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart2, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart3, org.eclipse.ui.part.IWorkbenchPartOrientation, ConnectionListener, Clearable, Lockable
public class ConnectionView
extends ScrolledView
implements ConnectionListener, org.eclipse.jface.util.IPropertyChangeListener, Lockable, Clearable

The Connection View displays the current connection status and allows for control of the connection between a robot and the workbench.

Current connection types supported include:

  • Network
  • Com

Since:
version 1.0.0
Author:
Dan Cowan

Field Detail

ID

public static final java.lang.String ID
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ConnectionView

public ConnectionView()
C'tor.

Must be no-args for Eclipse extension point.

The constructor for the view will get a reference to the Connection object from the base HAL, assuming one has been registered. The view is initialised from the plugin's preference store.

getID

public java.lang.String getID()
Description copied from class: ScrolledView
Return the part's ID string.

The ID string should follow the convention:

pugin.name.partName

Help contexts are registered against the parts getID() method

Specified by:
